title: Polymethoxyflavones extracted fromBauhinia championiialleviate LPS-induced acute lung injury by ameliorating endoplasmic reticulum stress.
abstract: Acute lung injury (ALI), a critical respiratory condition, often escalates into acute respiratory distress syndrome, which is associated with significant morbidity and mortality.Bauhinia championii, a botanical drug used in traditional Chinese medicine, is reputed for its antioxidative and anti-hypoxia effects. However, the active metabolites withinB. championiiand their mechanisms of action in alleviating ALI remain to be elucidated.
